intro: Acetosella leucantha, commonly known as white sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Acetosella leucantha is also known for its sour taste due to the presence of oxalic acid in its leaves.
